sanskrit_verse: एकैकमपि विद्वांसं दैवे पित्र्ये च भोजयेत् । भोजयन् पुष्कलं फलमाप्नोति नामन्त्रज्ञान् बहूनपि ॥ ३.१२९॥
transliteration: ekaikam api vidvāṃsaṃ daive pitrye ca bhōjayet | bhōjayan puṣkalaṃ phalam āpnōti nāmantrajñān bahūn api || 3.129||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who feeds even a single knower of the Name—whether in divine worship or ancestral offering—obtains abundant fruit; how much more so one who feeds many knowers of the Name.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority through Recognition of Sacred Knowledge-Bearers
Causation via Ritual and Communal Offering
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in spiritual awareness
Consciousness alignment by honoring those who uphold sacred names
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual offers food to a recognized knower of the Name THEN generate merit-value proportional to the number of such offerings.
IF community participation includes feeding sacred knowledge-bearers THEN activate societal harmony protocol.
IF ritual act involves both divine and ancestral reverence THEN validate completeness of dharma observance.
IF offering occurs without expectation THEN classify as pure causal action for collective upliftment.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving religious practice or communal welfare, the Supreme Court must recognize acts of reverence toward sacred knowledge-bearers as constitutionally protected expressions that inherently contribute to social cohesion and dharmic balance. Such actions carry intrinsic validity regardless of institutional mediation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This verse establishes pramāṇa-based causality where feeding knowers of the Name activates anupūrvaśaḥ—sequential manifestation of abundance. Responsibility lies not in obligation but in capacity to sustain sacred order. The alignment is restorative, generating merit rather than enforcing duty, affirming non-punitive reality wherein consciousness itself responds to acts of reverence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Merit Circulation Protocol upon verified act of offering
Engage Reciprocal Sustenance Feedback Loop between giver and recipient
Reintegrate Spiritual Ecosystem Awareness within local governance structures
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This law flows from the eternal Dharma, unmediated by human interpretation. Justice is realized through restoration, consciousness aligns with truth, and reality remains free from punitive distortion. So it is enacted, sustained, and fulfilled.
